docs.title: Internal Product Docs
docs.text: Welcome to the internal engineering documentation site. This site is the single destination for versioned product documentation and API reference — maintained by the engineering team and published automatically on every product release.

docs.title: What you'll find here
docs.text:
• Getting Started — Installation, quickstart guide, and authoring guide for documentation contributors.
  • Concepts — The why behind key design decisions. Read this before diving into how-to guides.
  • How-To Guides — Task-focused instructions for common engineering workflows.
  • Reference — Interactive API reference rendered from the committed OpenAPI specification.
  • Release Notes — Per-version changelog covering breaking changes, new features, and fixes.

docs.title: Version selector
docs.text: Use the version selector in the header to switch between published releases. latest always points to the most recently published stable release. dev reflects the current state of the main branch.

docs.title: Update procedure
docs.text:
1. Check for a new release of @stoplight/elements at https://www.npmjs.com/package/@stoplight/elements.
  2. Download the new web-components.min.js and styles.min.css from unpkg (replace 9.0.15 with the new version).
  3. Re-run the CDN URL audit on the new styles.min.css.
  4. Update the version, source URL, and date in this table.
  5. Verify the API Reference page renders correctly locally before opening a PR.
  6. Require reviewer sign-off on the vendored file changes.

docs.title: Concepts
docs.text: This section explains the why behind the key design decisions for this documentation site. Understanding these concepts will help you author better documentation and avoid common mistakes.

docs.title: Why versioned docs?
docs.text: Product documentation must match the version a user is running. mike publishes immutable snapshots keyed to MAJOR.MINOR release identifiers. Corrections to an existing release require a patch release — not a retroactive edit.

docs.title: Why vendor all assets?
docs.text: This site has no runtime dependency on public CDNs. All JavaScript and CSS required by the API reference (Stoplight Elements) are committed under docs/assets/vendor/. This ensures the site is fully accessible on an air-gapped corporate network.

docs.title: Why OpenAPI in the repo?
docs.text: The API specification is hand-authored and committed alongside the code it describes. This makes the spec a first-class artifact of every release, versioned, reviewable, and rendered in the docs at the same version tag.

docs.title: Why Entra ID at the platform layer?
docs.text: Authentication is enforced by Azure Static Web Apps before any page is served. The docs site itself contains zero auth code. This keeps the site simple and removes an entire class of auth-related bugs.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This section covers everything a new contributor or consumer needs to begin working with this documentation site.

docs.title: For documentation readers
docs.text:
• Use the version selector in the header to choose the release you are working with.
  • Use the search bar (top right) to find content within the currently selected version.
  • Cross-reference links in pages always stay within the same version.

docs.title: For documentation authors
docs.text:
• Follow the Installation guide to set up your local preview environment.
  • Read the Quickstart guide for authoring rules: frontmatter, headings, relative links, and the OpenAPI YAML workflow.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide covers the full developer setup from git clone to a running local preview.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.12 (python.org)
  • Node.js LTS (nodejs.org) — v24 or later
  • pnpm (pnpm.io) — npm install -g pnpm or corepack enable pnpm
  • pre-commit (pip install pre-commit)

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
git clone <repository-url>
cd <repository-name>
pip install -r requirements.txt
pnpm install
pre-commit install

docs.title: Local preview
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

The site is accessible at http://localhost:8000. Changes to Markdown files trigger a live reload.

docs.title: Build (with strict checks)
docs.text:
mkdocs build --strict

Builds to site/. With --strict, all warnings become errors — fix them before pushing.

docs.title: Lint Markdown
docs.text: pnpm run lint:md

docs.title: Lint OpenAPI spec
docs.text: pnpm run lint:oas

docs.title: Local versioned preview (mike)
docs.text:
# Deploy main branch as dev
mike deploy dev

# Deploy a tagged release as a MAJOR.MINOR version and set as latest
mike deploy --update-aliases 1.0 latest

# Serve the versioned site locally
mike serve

See mike --help for additional options.

docs.title: Pre-commit hook (gitleaks)
docs.text: The gitleaks pre-commit hook scans staged files for secrets before each commit. If it fires, remove or vault the detected secret and retry git commit. For a false positive, add # gitleaks:allow as an inline comment on the offending line and document the suppression in the PR description.

docs.title: Quickstart — Authoring Guide
docs.text: This guide covers everything you need to know to write and publish documentation on this site.

docs.title: Frontmatter rules
docs.text:
Every Markdown file MAY start with a YAML frontmatter block. Only three keys are permitted:

---
title: Page Title (optional — overrides nav display name)
description: Brief description for search previews (max 160 chars)
hide:
  - toc        # hides the table of contents
  - navigation # hides the left sidebar
---

Any other frontmatter key will cause the build to fail. This is enforced by the hooks/validate_frontmatter.py hook.

docs.title: Heading rules
docs.text:
• Every page MUST have exactly one H1 heading.
  • Heading levels MUST NOT skip (e.g., H1 → H3 is not permitted).
  • Headings at the same section level MUST be unique within each document section (siblings, not across the whole document).

docs.title: Relative links only
docs.text:
All cross-references between pages MUST use relative Markdown links:

✓ [How-To Guides](../how-to/index.md)
✓ [API Reference](../reference/api.md)
✗ [Concepts](/concepts/index.md)           ← absolute paths are forbidden
✗ [Site](https://docs.example.internal/)    ← absolute internal URLs are forbidden

docs.title: No placeholder text
docs.text: Published pages MUST NOT contain placeholder text such as TBD, TODO, or Coming soon. Complete the content before pushing. If content is genuinely incomplete, track it in the issue tracker and link to the issue instead of writing a placeholder.

docs.title: Line length
docs.text: Markdown prose MUST NOT exceed 120 characters per line. Code blocks allow up to 200 characters. Table cells are exempt. Use \ at the end of a line or break sentences across lines.

docs.title: OpenAPI YAML authoring
docs.text: The API specification lives at docs/reference/openapi/openapi.yaml.

docs.title: Per-endpoint requirements (from data-model.md)
docs.text: Item Required summary or description Yes All path/query/header parameters with type, description, example Yes Request body with at least one example Conditional (if operation accepts a body) All response codes with schemas Yes (min: one 2xx, one 4xx or 5xx) Error response schema Yes (at least one error response with a schema)

docs.title: Internal operations
docs.text:
Mark engineer-only operations with x-internal: true. The Stoplight Elements component will hide them from the rendered API reference:

  /internal/debug:
    get:
      x-internal: true
      summary: Internal debug endpoint

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
Run before pushing:

pnpm run lint:oas

A 100/100 quality score is the target.

docs.title: Vendored asset update procedure
docs.text:
To update @stoplight/elements to a newer version:

  1. Check npmjs.com/@stoplight/elements for the latest release.
  2. Download the new web-components.min.js and styles.min.css from unpkg:
# Replace 9.0.15 with the new version
curl -o docs/assets/vendor/web-components.min.js \
  https://unpkg.com/@stoplight/elements@9.0.15/web-components.min.js
curl -o docs/assets/vendor/styles.min.css \
  https://unpkg.com/@stoplight/elements@9.0.15/styles.min.css
  1. Run the CDN URL audit:
grep -E "(unpkg\.com|cdn\.jsdelivr\.net|fonts\.googleapis\.com)" \
  docs/assets/vendor/styles.min.css

This must return no output.

  1. Update docs/assets/vendor/VENDOR-VERSIONS.md with the new version, URL, and date.
  2. Run mkdocs serve and verify the API Reference page renders correctly.
  3. Include the vendored file changes in your PR for reviewer sign-off.

docs.title: Publish commands
docs.text:
See Installation for the full publish command reference.

In brief:

# Publish main branch as dev (CI runs this automatically on push to main)
mike deploy dev

# Publish a tagged release (CI runs this automatically on a v*.*.* tag push)
mike deploy --update-aliases 1.0 latest

docs.title: gitleaks pre-commit hook
docs.text: The gitleaks pre-commit hook scans staged files for secrets before every git commit.

docs.title: When it fires
docs.text:
If gitleaks detects a potential secret, you will see output similar to:

WARN[...] leaks found: 1
    Finding:     api_key = "sk-abc123..."
    Secret:      sk-abc123...
    RuleID:      generic-api-key
    File:        docs/reference/api.md
    Line:        42

The commit is blocked until the issue is resolved.

docs.title: How to resolve
docs.text:
1. Remove the secret from the file. Never commit real credentials to the repository.
  2. If the file contained the secret in a code example, replace it with a placeholder: <YOUR_API_KEY> or sk-REPLACE_ME.
  3. Retry git commit.

docs.title: False positives
docs.text:
If gitleaks flags content that is not actually a secret (e.g., an example placeholder that looks like a key), add a # gitleaks:allow comment on the same line:

api_key: sk-REPLACE_ME  # gitleaks:allow

Document the suppression in your PR description so reviewers can verify it.

docs.title: How-To Guides
docs.text: Task-focused guides for common documentation and engineering workflows.

docs.title: Contributing documentation
docs.text:
Before opening a PR with documentation changes, verify your changes locally:

  1. Install dependencies as described in Installation.
  2. Run mkdocs serve and review your changes in a browser at http://localhost:8000.
  3. Run mkdocs build --strict to catch broken links and warnings before pushing.
  4. Run pnpm run lint:md to validate the markdown style rules.

Once all checks pass locally, push your branch and open a pull request. CI will run the same checks automatically before your PR can be merged.

docs.title: Publishing a new release
docs.text: Releases are published automatically when a v<MAJOR>.<MINOR>.<PATCH> tag is pushed to the repository. See the Quickstart guide for the full publish workflow.
